monster.name: Ancient Gold Shadow Dragon

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The dragon can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Living Shadow
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the dragon has resistance to damage that isn't force, psychic, or radiant.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the dragon can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the dragon has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Ancient Gold Shadow Dragon's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 25}, {@hit 17} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d10 + 10}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 25} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

{@b Shadow Breath.} The dragon exhales shadowy mist in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw, taking 71 ({@damage 13d10}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

{@b Weakening Breath.} The dragon exhales gas in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC25 Strength saving throw or have disadvantage on Strength-based attack rolls, Strength checks, and Strength saving throws for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The dragon magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice).

In a new form, the dragon retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

legendaryHeader: The dragon can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The dragon regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 15 ft. of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

trait.name: Actor
entries: Le Capitaine has advantage on Charisma ({@skill Deception}) and Charisma ({@skill Performance}) checks made to hide his identity.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darkvision.

trait.name: Gift of the Depths
entries: Le Capitaine can breathe underwater.

trait.name: Investment of the Chain Master
entries: As a bonus action, Le Capitaine can command his familiar to take the Attack action.

trait.name: Repelling Blast
entries: When Le Capitaine hits a creature with eldritch blast, he can push the creature up to 10 feet away from him in a straight line

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Le Capitaine's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Le Capitaine is a 10th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). Le Capitaine has the following warlock spells prepared:

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Change Appearance
entries: Le Capitaine can change his appearance and voice. He determine the specifics of the changes and can adjust his height and weight, but must remain medium sized.
He stays in this new form until he uses an action to revert to his true form or until he die.

action.name: Command Familiar
entries: Le Capitaine's familiar makes one Attack of its own with its Reaction.

action.name: Fey Presence (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Le Capitaine causes each creature in a 10-foot cube to make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} until the end of his next turn.

action.name: Rod of the Pact Keeper (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: Le Capitaine regains one warlock spell slot.

reaction.name: Beguiling Defenses
entries: When another creature attempts to charm Le Capitaine he can force them to make a 16 {@dc Wisdom} saving throw or be {@condition charmed} for 1 minute or until the creature takes any damage.

reaction.name: Misty Escape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: In response to taking damage, Le Capitaine turns {@condition invisible} and teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space he can see. He remains invisible until the start of his next turn or until it attacks, makes a damage roll, or casts a spell.

reaction.name: Protect Familiar
entries: When Le Capitaine's familiar takes damage, it instead has resistance to that damage.

reaction.name: Shape Up, Ye Dog (2/Day)
entries: Whenever a friendly creature within 30 feet of Le Capitaine that can hear him misses with an attack, Le Capitaine can yell perilous threats to allow that creature to reroll the attack roll.

immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Actor
entries: Syl has advantage on Charisma ({@skill Deception}) and Charisma ({@skill Performance}) checks made to hide his identity.

trait.name: Cloak of Displacement
entries: Attack rolls against Syl have disadvantage until they take damage, at which point this property ceases to function until the start of their next turn.

trait.name: Crossbow Expert
entries: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn’t impose disadvantage on Syl's ranged attack rolls

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the Syl's darkvision.

trait.name: Eldritch Master (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: Syl can spend 1 minute entreating their patron for aid to regain all the expended spell slots from thierr Pact Magic feature.

trait.name: Eldritch Mind
entries: Syl has advantage on Constitution saving throws that made to maintain concentration on a spell.

trait.name: Investment of the Chain Master
entries: As a bonus action, Syl can command his familiar to take the Attack action.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/day)
entries: If Syl fails a saving throw, they can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Syl has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Syl's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Velradin's Arcana
entries: All cantrips Syl casts act as if they are cast one tier higher than they are; either using an additional damage dice or targeting an additional creature.

trait.name: Agonizing Blast
entries: When Syl hits a creature with eldritch blast, each damage roll gets a +6 bonus.

trait.name: Fey Vision
entries: The Usurper's sees creatures in the range of their blindsight as if they were highlighted in a purple light, even if they are hidden or {@condition invisible}. Attack rolls against these highlighted creatures have advantage.

action.name: Revengence

action.name: Claw

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 5d4 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Change Appearance

He stays in this new form until he uses an action to revert to his true form or until he dies.

action.name: Dark Delirium (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Syl chooses a creature to must make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, it is {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} of Syl for 1 minute or until their concentration is broken, during which time the creature thinks it is lost in a misty realm, the appearance of which Syl chooses. The creature can see and hear only itself, Syl, and the illusion.

action.name: Fey Presence (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)

action.name: Velradin's Favor (2/Long Rest)

reaction.name: Beguiling Defenses

reaction.name: Investment of the Chain Master
entries: When Syl's familiar takes damage, they can to grant it resistance against that damage.

reaction.name: Misty Escape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)

entries: Syl attacks with {@i {@b Revengence}}.

legendary.name: Misty Transport
entries: Syl uses {@i misty step} without expending a spell slot.

legendary.name: Beguiling Misdirection
entries: Syl targets one creature they can see within 60 feet of them. The target must succeed a {@dc 16} or becomes {@condition charmed} by Syl and must use its reaction to move up to half its speed to point of Syl's choice that they can see.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)

legendary.name: Misty Escape (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Syl recharges the use of their {@i {@b Misty Escape}}.

legendary.name: Shadow Gauntlets (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Syl attacks with their {@b {@i Shadow Gauntlets}}.

legendaryGroup.name: Ancient Gold Shadow Dragon
regionalEffects: The region containing a legendary gold dragon's lair is warped by the dragon's magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Whenever a creature that can understand a language sleeps or enters a state of trance or reverie within 6 miles of the dragon's lair, the dragon can establish telepathic contact with that creature and converse with it in its dreams. The creature must make a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or remembers its conversation with the dragon and be be {@condition frightened} upon waking for 2 ({@damage 1d4}) days.

Banks of sickly, shadowy mist manifest within 6 miles of the dragon's lair. The mist lightly obscures the area. It assumes haunting forms when good creatures are near the dragon or other non-evil creatures in the mist, warning such creatures of the danger.
Gems and pearls within 1 mile of the dragon's lair lose color and start to give off a wispy, shadowy smoke.

regionalEffects: If the dragon dies, these effects end immediately.
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the dragon takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the dragon can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: The dragon glimpses the future, so it has advantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws until initiative count 20 on the next round.

One creature the dragon can see within 120 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be banished to a dream plane, a different plane of existence the dragon has imagined into being. To escape, the creature must use its action to make a Charisma check contested by the dragon's. If the creature wins, it escapes the dream plane. Otherwise, the effect ends on initiative count 20 on the next round. When the effect ends, the creature reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that one is occupied.

legendaryGroup.name: Syl
regionalEffects: The region containing the Usurper's lair is warped by her magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Magic saturates the area within 6 miles of the lair, causing minor random effects similar to a prestidigitation cantrip.

The warforged army thoroughly patrols within 6 miles of the Syl's lair. Most of the time these soldiers are intimidating and nothing more, but when a creature acts against the interests of the Syl, the warforged can interfere and cause any relevant die roll to be made with disadvantage.
Syl can cast access the senses of any soldier within 6 miles of their lair, similar to a clairvoyance spell.

regionalEffects: If Syl dies, the first two effects fade over the course of 2d10 days.
lairActions: When fighting inside its lair, Syl caFn invoke the ambient magic to take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Syl can take one lair action to cause one of the following effects:

items: Syl wills darkness to overpower the light. All bright light sources in the lair shed only dim light to their normal bright light radius, and dim light sources are extinguished. This lasts until Syl dismisses the effect or dies.

An opaque wall of writhing shadows springs up from a solid surface within 120 feet of Syl. The wall is up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick. Each creature in the area must make a successful {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage. Creatures in the wall's space are pushed 5 feet out of the wall's space, appearing on whichever side of the wall they choose. A creature can move through the wall, but the semimaterial shadow resists intrusion. For every foot a creature travels through the wall, it must spend 4 feet of movement. Furthermore, any creature that, during its own turn, occupies any part of the wall's space takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage, or half damage with a successful {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. Each 10-foot section of wall has AC 5, 15 hit points, vulnerability to radiant damage, resistance to bludgeoning and piercing damage, and immunity to cold, poison, and psychic damage. The wall lasts until Syl uses this lair action again, or until they die.

The Syl summons a warforged soldier to act as a companion in battle (your choice of unit). Roll 1d6. On a roll of 1-3, the soldier has a level of 4. On a roll of 4 or 5, the soldier has a level of 8. On a roll of 6, 2 level 8 soldiers appear.
